entry.title: Roku 锁定设备直至用户同意新服务条款
entry.content:
Scharon Harding，Ars Technica 报道：

本月，Roku 支持论坛上的用户报告在打开 Roku 电视或流媒体设备时突然看到一条消息：“我们进行了一项重要更新：我们更新了争议解决条款。选择“同意”即同意这些更新的条款并继续享受我们的产品和服务。按 * 查看这些更新的条款。”接下来是一个写着“同意”的大按钮。该弹出窗口不提供表达不同意见的方式，用户除非同意，否则无法使用他们的设备。 [...]

Roku 进一步激怒了客户，他们发现不同意其更新的条款比必要的更困难。 Roku 愿意按一下按钮就接受其条款，但要选择退出，用户必须克服重重困难，包括找到那本旧邮票。

要选择退出 Roku 的服务条款更新（主要更改了“争议解决条款”），用户必须致函 Roku 位于加利福尼亚州的总法律顾问，并提及：“选择退出的每个人的姓名以及每个此类人的联系信息、具体产品所使用的有问题的型号、软件或服务、您用于设置 Roku 帐户的电子邮件地址（如果您有的话），以及您的购买收据副本（如果适用）。” Roku 之前也要求所有这些选择退出其条款。

要求提供书面信函（以及购买收据的副本——有多少人会为可能已经购买了多年的商品保留它？）对于他们的客户来说简直就是一个巨大的“操你”。

entry.summary: 三月和四月开放每周赞助和脱口秀。
entry.content:
在售完几个月后，DF即将推出的赞助计划目前异常开放——包括即将到来的一周。

自从2007 年我开始出售 Daring Fireball 以来，每周赞助一直是 Daring Fireball 的最大收入来源。我认为他们成功了，因为他们让每个人都高兴。他们赚了很多钱。每周只有一位赞助商，而且赞助商总是与至少相当一部分 DF 受众相关，因此作为读者的您永远不会感到烦恼，并且希望经常对他们感兴趣。而且，从赞助商的角度来看，它们确实有效。我最喜欢的是有多少赞助商在看到结果后在接下来的几周内返回。

如果您认为 DF 的受众（痴迷于高品质和良好设计的人群）会对您的产品或服务感兴趣，请与我们联系。再次强调，下周仍然开放。

此外，赞助脱口秀节目对于赞助该网站的许多相同服务和产品来说是一个很好的机会。而且由于每集最多有三个赞助商，因此价格明显低于整个网站的每周赞助。播客行业的广告正在经历剧变，我的节目真切地感受到了这一点。那些听ATP的人都知道他们也是如此，我敢打赌，几乎所有您最喜欢的基于广告的播客也是如此。从广义上讲，我所看到的是，早年的播客是全面独立的——独立播客拥有独立赞助商。然后，当播客迅速流行时，广告公司介入了，我的节目中的大部分节目——以及我听的节目中的大部分节目——都通过广告公司卖给了互联网初创品牌。这些品牌和产品都很棒——像 Warby Parker 眼镜、Casper 床垫、Hullo 枕头这样的公司，你知道这些类型——但与广告公司打交道过去（现在仍然）比直接与较小的独立公司打交道要麻烦得多（这是我如何出售几乎所有每周赞助名额）。

因此，如果您有一个应用程序、产品、服务或任何您认为适合 Daring Fireball 的内容，我鼓励您考虑赞助 The Talk Show。近年来，小型独立产品在脱口秀赞助商中的代表性严重不足，但我希望改变这一现状。再次强调，重复赞助商的数量是我能提供的最好的证明，证明它具有巨大的价值。 （那些大品牌通过广告代理商跟踪他们的结果。）我自己不出售播客赞助，所以如果您有兴趣，请与 Neat.fm 的 Elaine Pow 联系。未来几个月会有大量空缺职位，我们很高兴为首次赞助商提供折扣来填补空缺。

我有点讨厌写这些赞助拉皮条的帖子，但从会计的角度来看，我的工作是广告推销员，而不是作家/播客。显而易见的事实是，我应该比我更频繁地在网站和播客上公开宣传这些赞助。 （如果我有老板，我几年前就会被这份销售工作解雇。）

entry.content:
史诗游戏：

苹果已告诉我们并向欧盟委员会承诺，他们将恢复我们的开发者帐户。这向开发商发出了强烈的信号，即欧盟委员会将迅速采取行动执行《数字市场法案》并追究看门人的责任。我们正在按计划推进 Epic Games Store 的推出，并将《堡垒之夜》带回欧洲 iOS 平台。向前！

蒂姆·斯威尼：

DMA 经历了第一次重大挑战，苹果禁止 Epic Games 瑞典与 App Store 竞争，DMA 刚刚取得了第一次重大胜利。在欧盟委员会进行迅速调查后，苹果通知欧盟委员会和 Epic，它将软化并恢复我们的访问权限，根据 DMA 法在欧洲恢复《堡垒之夜》并推出 Epic Games Store。

对于欧洲法治、欧盟委员会以及全世界开发商的言论自由来说，这是一个巨大的胜利。 #免费堡垒之夜！

这是对昨天欧盟委员会蒂埃里·布雷顿 (Thierry Breton) 的一条推文的回应（表情符号和主题标签未受影响） ：

🚨在#DMA 下，看门人没有空间通过威胁来压制开发者。

我已要求我们的服务部门优先考虑苹果终止 Epic 开发者帐户的问题。

致 🇪🇺 和 🌍 的所有开发者：现在是对把关人的合规解决方案发表意见的时候了！

（昨晚我精疲力尽之前，我已经准备好了这篇文章的一个版本；我似乎写得不够快，无法跟上苹果公司的欧盟监管冒险。我认为，今天的犹豫是一个特别好的插曲并且仍然具有相关性，但其最新新闻的保质期约为 6 小时。）

理论 A：苹果正在玩大师级的棋，并精心策划了整个来来回回，为欧盟赢得了一场高调的胜利——“看，DMA 才发布一天，就已经开始发挥作用，表明我们可以推动Apple around ”——关于 Apple 从一开始就应该开放的 Epic Games Store。这是对一件事情的大量宣传，我不认为苹果会做出重大让步。

理论B：苹果在试图应对自主权丧失的问题上时断时续。

我投 B 票，因为对我来说，苹果真正的胜利就是让 Epic 利用他们的瑞典子公司开设一家 iOS 游戏商店，而不需要来来回回。如果苹果公司走了这条路，欧盟委员会仍然可以因证明 DMA 有效性而受到赞扬，而且苹果公司看起来会慷慨地遵守法律。但事情实际发生的方式表明，他们是不情愿地遵守规定，更糟糕的是，这引发了人们对苹果机构傲慢和报复心理的最坏假设。

苹果似乎对这个史诗般的事情特别措手不及（借用一个甚至欧盟公民也可能明白的体育类比）。再说一遍，我认为苹果应该让 Epic 在欧盟开设 Epic Games Store。我认为苹果本可以从宣布 DMA 合规计划的那一刻起就明确表示，Epic 仍然没有资格获得开发者帐户，因为他们四年前公然违反了 App Store 规则。欧盟委员会可能——而且我认为也会——迫使苹果公司在这一点上做出让步，但它的裁决本可以不带任何苹果方面的恶意或小气的暗示。

但苹果却采取了最糟糕的方式：他们让 Epic 的瑞典子公司开设一个新的苹果开发者帐户，并继续致力于建立Epic 宣布的游戏商店，然后才撤销了 Epic 的开发者帐户，同时几乎从字面上证明它不合理理由是 Epic 不值得信任，因为他们是一个令人震惊的规则破坏者，而是因为 Tim Sweeney 继续表达他关于 App Store 是非法垄断的尖锐（或者如果你愿意，可以是丰富多彩的）观点。苹果不会因批评苹果而撤销开发者许可。但很多人——包括欧盟委员会！ ——现在想想苹果就是这么做的。

为什么欧盟委员会不会像苹果公司那样进行“优先”调查？如果苹果从一开始就让 Epic 继续前进，他们就会显得很宽宏大量。蒂姆·斯威尼（Tim Sweeney）甚至称其为“善意之举”。但就目前情况而言，苹果公司看起来很痛苦，从欧盟委员会的角度来看，需要密切监管。

entry.content:
好吧，我的理论就到此为止了，即苹果公司正在与 Epic Games 搞好关系——让过去的事情成为过去，并允许 Epic 在欧盟开设 iOS 游戏市场。 Epic，在他们的公司博客上：

我们最近宣布Apple 批准了我们的 Epic Games Scotland AB 开发者帐户。得益于数字市场法案 (DMA)，我们打算使用该帐户将 Epic Games Store 和 Fortnite 引入欧洲的 iOS 设备。令我们惊讶的是，Apple 已经终止了该帐户，现在我们无法开发 iOS 版 Epic Games Store。这是对 DMA 的严重违反，表明苹果无意在 iOS 设备上允许真正的竞争。 [...]

通过终止 Epic 的开发者帐户，苹果正在消灭苹果应用商店最大的潜在竞争对手之一。他们正在削弱我们成为一个可行的竞争对手的能力，他们正在向其他开发者展示当你试图与苹果竞争或批评他们的不公平做法时会发生什么。

如果苹果继续保留自行决定将第三方市场从 iOS 中剔除的权力，那么任何理性的开发者都不会愿意使用第三方应用商店，因为他们随时可能与受众永久分离。

Epic 似乎认为苹果不得对 DMA 下的应用市场运营者进行任何形式的监督。如果 Epic 无法运营自己的游戏商店市场，那么苹果就不会遵守 DMA——这似乎是他们的立场。常识表明这不可能是正确的。开发者必须跨越某种界限，才能证明苹果有理由撤销他们的开发者帐户。有人可能会说，Epic 在 2020 年对《堡垒之夜》和应用内支付所做的事情并没有跨越这一界限。但这并不是 Epic 所主张的——他们认为 DMA 禁止任何此类行为，并且苹果没有自由裁量权来决定谁可以运行并继续运行应用程序市场。

我猜 Epic 是在暗示欧盟政府，而不是苹果，应该有这样的自由裁量权？他们没有这么说，但是除了苹果之外还有谁可以拥有这样的自由裁量权呢？但欧盟委员会并不是为此类警察工作而设立的。欧盟委员会不是这样运作的。 DMA 并没有说 EC 现在运行应用程序市场。

菲尔·席勒 (Phil Schiller) 2 月 23 日发给蒂姆·斯威尼 (Tim Sweeney) 的一封电子邮件中的史诗引述如下：

您对我们的 DMA 合规计划的五花八门的批评，加上 Epic 过去故意违反其不同意的合同条款的做法，强烈表明 Epic 瑞典不打算遵守这些规则。另一种故意破坏可能会威胁 iOS 平台的完整性以及用户的安全和隐私。

您曾表示，允许 Epic Games Scotland 加入开发者计划是“Apple 的善意之举”。我们邀请您向我们提供书面保证，证明您的行为也是真诚的，并且无论您的公开行为和言论如何，Epic Games 瑞典都会履行其所有承诺。请用简单、无保留的语言告诉我们为什么这次我们应该信任 Epic。

斯威尼的回应：

嗨，菲尔，感谢您与我们联系。 Epic 及其子公司秉持诚信行事，并将遵守与 Apple 签订的当前和未来协议的所有条款，我们很乐意就您想要的主题向 Apple 提供任何具体的进一步保证。

此致，

-蒂姆

Apple 的代表律师 Mark Perry 在致 Epic 律师的一封信中传达了 Epic Games Scotland AB 的 Apple 开发者帐户被终止的信息：

斯威尼先生对该请求的答复完全不充分且不可信。它归结为一个不受支持的“相信我们”。然而，历史表明，Epic 确实不值得信任，因此需要做出有意义的承诺。斯威尼简短回应中的最低限度保证很快就被一连串对苹果政策、合规计划和商业模式的公开攻击所削弱。仅举一个例子： https://x.com/TimSweeneyEpic/status/1762243725533532587 ?s=20。

在我看来，蒂姆·斯威尼（Tim Sweeney）的推文作为例子似乎并没有什么出格。诚然，这很刺耳，但我们知道斯威尼支持一种监管结构，该结构将合法地要求苹果将 iPhone 视为或多或少像 Mac 一样开放的平台。我们知道苹果强烈反对这一点——但我不认为陈述这种观点应该取消 Epic 获得开发者帐户的资格。苹果应该坚持 Epic在 2020 年故意违反 App Store 规则的《堡垒之夜》 。毫无争议的是，他们当时公然违反了规则。如果苹果想将其设为“终身”禁令，他们应该直接说出来。

引用最近的推文，比如斯威尼的，这些都是批评性的——甚至是严厉的批评（或者借用席勒的术语，“丰富多彩的”）——只会让人觉得苹果的政策是，如果开发者批评应用商店的规则，苹果就会惩罚他们。说出来。我认为这根本不是苹果的政策，但有些人认为是，而 Epic 的情况更是强化了这一点。

例如，Spotify 和 Epic 一样强烈批评 App Store，而且苹果并没有威胁他们取消 Spotify 的开发者计划会员资格。 Spotify 和 Epic 之间的区别不在于他们的言辞，而在于他们的言辞。这是他们过去的行为。

今天 Epic 的博客文章发表后，苹果向 The Verge和 9to5Mac （或许还有其他媒体）发表了一份声明：

“Epic 严重违反了其对 Apple 的合同义务，导致法院裁定 Apple 有权随时终止 Epic Games 控制下的“任何或全部 Epic Games 的全资子公司、附属公司和/或其他实体”。苹果自行决定。鉴于 Epic 过去和当前的行为，苹果选择行使这一权利。”

这是一个更强烈、更厚脸皮的论点。事实是，Epic 故意违反《堡垒之夜》付款噱头的规定。忽略那些争论苹果滥用垄断地位的推文。

但为什么不趁机表现一下大度呢？不应该指望苹果会卑躬屈膝，但这看起来他们正在不遗余力地表现出报复性的态度。我真的认为与 Epic 搞好关系是一种聪明的公关柔术，即使在库比蒂诺，这是咬牙切齿的。

就吃爆米花而言，我真的很好奇苹果公司援引美国法院的一项裁决作为禁止 Epic 瑞典子公司持有开发者账户的理由。如果欧盟委员会认为该裁决不适用，会发生什么？ Epic在欧盟向苹果提起的诉讼从未败诉，那么这件事的结果会如何呢？

entry.title: Meta 的 WhatsApp 和 Messenger E2EE 消息互操作计划
entry.content:

entry.title: “伟大的开发者窃取的是创意，而不是产品”
entry.content:
David Barnard 在 2011 年发表的一篇文章中谈到了经常被引用（并且经常被错误归因）的关于优秀艺术家复制和伟大艺术家偷窃的格言：

在围绕借用和偷窃之间的道德和语义差异进行讨论时，我一直忽略了更重要的一点。艾略特使用“窃取”这个词，并不是因为它有不道德的含义，而是为了暗示所有权。偷东西就是占有它。

当你窃取一个想法，并有时间和品味将其变成你自己的想法时，它就会变成不同的东西，希望是更伟大的东西。但随着你从其他产品借用的东西越来越多，结果中你的身影也越来越少。值得骄傲的东西越来越少，拥有的东西也越来越少。

巴纳德引用了这句格言的实际起源，来自 TS 艾略特，仅此一点就值得收藏。在艾略特的表述中，这不是复制与窃取，而是模仿与窃取。这种微妙的区别正在澄清。有创造力和道德的人通常会看到混音和抄袭之间的明显区别。我之所以补充这一点，是因为当他们自己的创作背后的想法被其他人重新混合（窃取）时，有些人真的感到被冒犯了。

举一个值得注意的例子，我认为 Android 作为一个整体，是 iPhone 的混搭版。但有一些特定的 Android 手机——从一些早期的三星 Galaxy 机型开始——抄袭了 iPhone 的硬件设计。然而，史蒂夫·乔布斯却有不同的看法。

（这并不是说谷歌并不经常是一个无耻的模仿者/抄袭者。）

如果您拥有Apple Fine -Woven iPhone盒，并且在过去几个月中定期使用它：

  • 它保持良好。
  • 一切正常。
  • 这是一块垃圾。

我不确定这是否是提出问题的最佳方法，也不是这些提出的最佳选择。虽然我希望该民意调查主要是由实际使用精美案例几个月的人回答的，但没有办法知道是否是这种情况（没有双关语）。结果：

投票数保持良好举起还可以一块垃圾
乳齿象916 33% 28% 40%
线程数2,819 20% 25% 56%
推特/X 3,324 18% 27% 55%
全部的7,059 21% 26% 53%

我不会将这些结果称为灾难性，但是它们很糟糕，超过一半的参与者选择“这是一块垃圾”，只有五分之一选择“它保持良好”。而且，精心打孔的案件直到五个月前才开始发货。因此，按照苹果的标准，也许这确实是灾难性的。

对于许多人（包括乔安娜·斯特恩（Joanna Stern））来说，这是背面的精美材料的磨损还不错。但是对于某些人来说，这是塑料侧 - 它们剥去了。这是三个月前的Stu Maschwitz的照片，此前他的案件仅使用了几周。凯文·福克斯（Kevin Fox）发布了一系列照片，表明用黎明洗涤剂（Dawn Datergent）清洗一个细陶器（不仅是水）可以清理至少一点点的粗糙性。如果您有兴趣，这三个社交线程中的每个线程中的每个人都有更多例子 - 包括一些人的案件效果很好的人。

我还指出了Mastodon上“ Ambiorickx”的答复：

一两周后，我的分层被分层，但替代者却保持不错。

因此，Maschwitz（和其他人）遇到的问题也许是塑料侧面剥落的问题，是苹果自此解决的生产问题。如果您有一个带有剥落的侧面的精美盒子，也许苹果是否会将其换成新的箱子？

但是，精织的材料本身似乎还不够耐用。好的皮革产品随着年龄的增长而看起来不错。 Finewoven没有这种品质。希望苹果的材料团队能回到绘图板上，从而做得更好。苹果没有回到皮革，但是他们需要比皮革更替代的替代品，而Finewoven 1.0不是。

旁注1：DF阅读器和iPhone盒

去年4月，我进行了一项有点相关的民意调查，要求DF读者：

您通常如何（意思是大部分时间）携带iPhone？

  • 苹果案

我怀疑DF读者是离群值的地方，是为苹果制造的案例支付高级价格的人数。人们购买苹果箱（以及钱包，看乐队），因为他们希望它们是很棒的产品。仅几个月后，一个$ 60的iPhone盒（或60美元的Magsafe钱包）看起来像是废话并不是一个好产品。

entry.title: “与PQ3的iMessage：大规模量子安全消息传递中的新最新状态”
entry.content:
苹果：

从历史上看，消息传递平台使用了经典的公共密钥加密，例如RSA，椭圆曲线签名和Diffie-Hellman键换交换，以建立设备之间安全的端到端加密连接。所有这些算法都是基于困难的数学问题，这些问题长期以来被认为是计算密集型的，即使计算摩尔定律也是如此。但是，量子计算的兴起可能会改变方程式。足够强大的量子计算机可以以根本不同的方式解决这些经典的数学问题，因此（从理论上讲）做得如此之快，以威胁到端到端加密通信的安全性。

尽管具有此功能的量子计算机尚不存在，但资源良好的攻击者已经可以通过利用现代数据存储成本的急剧下降来为他们的可能到达做准备。前提很简单：此类攻击者可以收集大量当今的加密数据并将其全部归档以供将来参考。即使他们今天无法解密任何此数据，他们仍可以保留它，直到他们购买了将来可以解密它的量子计算机，这是一种被称为Harvest的攻击情况，现在被解密。

为了减轻未来量子计算机的风险，密码界一直在研究量子后加密术（PQC）：新的公共密钥算法，这些算法为量子安全协议提供了构建块，但不需要量子计算机运行 - ，可以在我们今天使用的经典的非量词计算机上运行的协议，但这将不受未来量子计算机带来的已知威胁的安全。

一个非常有说服力的外行概述了一些非常高级的加密术。插槽就在DF上的两个最新主题：

  • iMessage无疑是一个高级，完全独立的消息传递平台。它仅说明了苹果消息应用程序的易用性（唯一的iMessage客户端），因此许多人错误地认为iMessage只是带有不同颜色的文本气泡，更高质量的图像和视频附件的短信。

  • 苹果有充分的理由不允许像蜂鸣器这样的未经授权的第三方客户。

最巧妙的是，苹果正在下一轮OS更新（iOS/iPados 17.4，MacOS 14.4和WatchOS 10.4）中将此升级推出到iMessage加密，并自动提及Visionos。除了更新其软件外，iMessage用户无需做任何其他事情，他们的通信将使用新的PQ3加密。

iMessage安全故事中的一个洞是旧设备 - 那些无法升级到最新操作系统的设备。在Apple设备不再能够运行当前操作系统之后，苹果设备往往会很有用，但这意味着iMessage通信仅与聊天中最古老的设备一样安全。我敢肯定，蜂鸣器能够完全工作的唯一原因是利用用于支撑旧设备的漏洞。

另一个漏洞仍然是iCloud备份，默认情况下，它继续使用Apple控制的密钥包括iMessage消息历史记录 - 这又意味着Apple可以并且确实可以用来将数据移交给执法人员时可以将数据移交给执法。仅使用高级数据保护是仅使用仅存储在个人设备上的密钥加密的消息备份。但是，即使在大胆的火球读者中（我认为这很公平地描述为精明的受众）， 只有少数派支持了高级数据保护。

即使您启用了高级数据保护，也无法知道与使用iMessage交流的人是否启用了它。

entry.summary: Apple Sports exemplifies why it's a better idea to design smaller, more focused apps.
entry.content:
Apple Newsroom :

“We created Apple Sports to give sports fans what they want — an app that delivers incredibly fast access to scores and stats,” said Eddy Cue, Apple's senior vice president of Services. “Apple Sports is available for free in the App Store, and makes it easy for users to stay up to date with their favorite teams and leagues.”

观察结果：

  • Apple Sports is indeed incredibly fast to load and update. Nearly instantaneous. You might think, “ So what, it's just loading scores and stats, of course it's fast ”, but the truth is ad tech, combined with poor programming, has made most sports apps slow to load. Most apps, period, really. Just being very fast to load ought not be a hugely differentiating factor in 2024, but it is. ( ESPN's app , for example, is incredibly slow to show anything useful after launching.)

  • Apple isn't listing several major sports leagues — including MLB, WNBA, and the king of all leagues, the NFL — but that's simply because they're not in season. They're only listing leagues currently playing. MLB, WNBA, and NFL will be included once they start playing.

  • Apple is including betting odds in game listings by default, with data from DraftKings. If you don't want to see gambling odds, you need to turn them off in Settings → Sports. I like DraftKings, and have an account there, but I generally find that their odds are outliers and fluctuate more from the consensus odds. FanDuel and BetMGM are both more in line with the consensus, at least for the NFL. (I have no idea if either FanDuel or BetMGM offer odds as an API service for an app like Sports, though.) Anyway, I'm just glad the odds are there.

  • Live activities for your lock screen are available, but Sports doesn't — yet — offer any Home Screen widgets.

  • Just like Apple's new Journal app , Sports is iPhone-only. There's no compatible version for Mac, Vision, TV, or Watch. The difference from Journal is that Journal is built-into iOS 17 (17.2 and later), but Sports is a download from the App Store — not built into the OS (yet?) — and can be installed on an iPad. But on iPad, it just runs in an iPhone layout. Does Apple think this Sports app is only relevant on iPhone (and perhaps, eventually, Apple Watch), or is this just the platform they targeted first and it'll be available as a proper iPad and Vision app eventually? (I'm thinking it might never be a Mac app. Once Sports offers Home Screen widgets, you'll be able to get those widgets on your Mac desktop via the feature that lets you put iPhone app widgets on your Mac.)

  • I generally have a good sense of why Apple does things the way it does, but it's not clear to me at all why Journal, say, is now built into iOS 17 but Sports is only available from the App Store. I sort of think Sports will be included by default in iOS 18, but maybe I'm missing something here.

  • Sports syncs your favorite teams (and leagues?) between the Apple TV and Apple News apps, so if you've already set favorite teams in either of those apps, Sports already knows them. Sports also integrates with the TV for “watch now” — not just for sports that Apple itself broadcasts (like MLS soccer and Friday Night Baseball), but for any live sporting events available through any available streaming apps. That's a killer feature. (ESPN, unsurprisingly, only has “where to watch” links for games broadcast on ESPN or ABC.)

  • The app this most sherlocks for me is Sports Alerts . I've been a big fan of Sports Alerts for years, and they've been great about adopting new features like Lock Screen Live Activities very quickly. But Apple Sports looks far better and offers far more clarity; Sports Alerts looks like what it is: a cross-platform app with an Android look-alike companion . A truly iOS-native live sports scores/stats app ought to be able to blow anything cross-platform out of the water, and Apple Sports seems to be that. Yahoo Sports has been sitting in my App Library, mostly unused, for years — I'll probably delete it now.

The design language of Apple Sports is new. I wouldn't say Sports looks much like Journal, but they're similar insofar as they both are using a new, very simple, very focused UI design language. Sports is closest aesthetically, perhaps, to Apple Weather. But Sports shares with Journal a sort of fundamental “Here's a scrollable feed of events, and there's a menu at the top right of the list” gestalt. Sports's simple layout and design is such that you don't need to drill down or hunt for what you want. You get three main utterly self-explanatory tabs at the top — Yesterday, Today, Upcoming — and within each tab is a list of sporting events. Tap any event to open a card for that event with all the details, and from that card view, you can either swipe side-to-side to switch between different different events, or swipe down to dismiss the card and go back to the main列表。 It's so simple and intuitive that it doesn't seem designed at all, but that's the sort of design that takes the most work and most iteration.

One question I've already seen asked is why make this a standalone app? Why not build it into the TV app or News app? The answer is speed, focus, and simplicity. There's a natural tendency in our industry — especially from big companies — to keep adding more and more features to existing apps and services. A big part of what made the iPhone so revolutionary was that the iPhone reset the thinking on that. The iPhone way of thinking is to have more apps that are smaller and more focused, not fewer apps that are bigger and more monolithic. Apple Sports exemplifies why it's a better idea to design smaller, more focused apps.

It's very rare for a new iPhone app, immediately upon debut, to land a spot on my first iPhone Home Screen. But Journal did, and so now has Sports.

entry.summary: When the CCP says device makers must jump to sell their products in China, Apple asks “How high?”
entry.content:
The European Commission, earlier this week :

Yesterday, the Commission has adopted decisions closing four market investigations that were launched on 5 September 2023 under the Digital Markets Act (DMA), finding that Apple and Microsoft should not be designated as gatekeepers for the following core platform services: Apple's messaging service iMessage, Microsoft's online search engine Bing, web browser Edge and online advertising service Microsoft Advertising.

The decisions conclude the Commission's investigations opened following the notification by Apple and Microsoft in July 2023 of the core platform services that met the quantitative thresholds. Among these notified services were also the four services concerned by today's decisions. Together with the notifications, Apple and Microsoft also submitted so-called 'rebuttal' arguments, explaining why despite meeting the quantitative thresholds, these four core platform services should not, in their view, qualify as gateways.

We've had pretty obvious hints since early September that iMessage and Bing would be considered exempt from “gatekeeper” status, and thus exempt from the DMA. Now that's official.

But in November, when Apple changed course and announced that it would support the RCS messaging standard , many Apple critics/EC cheerleaders simply presumed that Apple's change of mind on RCS was somehow the result of the EU's regulatory muscle. This made zero sense, other than revealing an irrational, dare I say fanatical, belief in the righteousness of overzealous government regulation versus natural market forces. For one thing, it made no sense timing-wise: word leaked from the EU in September that iMessage was not going to be considered a gatekeeper — a decision made official this week — but somehow Apple announced “coming next year” support for RCS in十一月？

Second, the DMA makes no mention of “RCS” anywhere. It's just not mentioned. There are provisions in the DMA regarding messaging platform “interoperability”, but that's about some sort of fantasy world where disparate platforms like iMessage, WhatsApp, Instagram DMs, and Facebook Messenger could be forced to allow the interchange of messages between platforms while maintaining end-to-end encryption, and open themselves to interop with upstarts like Signal. RCS isn't an interop protocol between messaging platforms. RCS is a messaging platform itself — one that offers no encryption in its standard, and which is controlled by cell phone carriers. RCS is just a slightly better replacement for SMS.

The surprisingly-commonly-held assumption that the EC forced Apple's change of mind on RCS is just lazy thinking: Apple said, for years , they didn't want to support RCS (true); the DMA is imposing new regulations on Apple that will force it to do some things Apple doesn't want to do (true); therefore it was the DMA that forced Apple to change its mind on RCS (fallacious conclusion) . It also belies an ignorance of what iMessage is. iMessage is not SMS with blue bubbles and higher-resolution attachments. iMessage is a wholly independent messaging platform that is offered as a free-of-charge service for Apple device owners , with full-featured clients for Mac, iPad, and Vision. You can — and most people do — use your phone number as your primary unique identifier for iMessage, but you can also use any email address attached to your Apple ID account. Other platforms that have nothing to do with carrier-based SMS or RCS messaging use phone numbers for identifiers too — eg Signal and WhatsApp — but iMessage stands alone among popular services for allowing you to use it without even having a phone or phone number.

RCS is like SMS in that you must have a phone, must have an active SIM card with a cellular carrier, and can only use that phone to use RCS. You might say, “ Hey, wait a minute, I send and receive SMS messages in the Messages app on my iPad and Mac — not just my iPhone.” But that's just clever programming on Apple's part. Every single green SMS message you send or receive on your iPad, Mac, or Vision Pro is being sent and received through your iPhone. Messages simply handles the “it just works” magic between your multiple devices to make it seem like other devices can act as true SMS client devices. Power your iPhone off and try to send or receive an SMS message from another Apple device. It doesn't work, because it can't work, because SMS is a phone carrier protocol. RCS is exactly the same in that regard. You need a phone to use RCS. You don't need a phone to use iMessage.

So even if iMessage had been deemed a “gatekeeper” messaging platform by the European Commission — which it was not — adding RCS support to the iPhone Messages app would not have mattered a whit when it came to DMA compliance. The Messages app is a client for multiple messaging platforms — SMS and iMessage. It's the iMessage platform that the DMA might have applied to. And adding support for RCS to the Messages app on iPhones wouldn't have made any difference at all regarding interoperability with non-cellular “gatekeeping” messaging platforms like WhatsApp and Facebook Messenger.

But then why did Apple do a 180° turn on RCS? I can't say for certain, alas, but after spending the last few months periodically poking around the trees inhabited by little birdies, I do have good news for fans of coercive government regulation. Apple's hand was effectively forced. But by China, not the EU.

Chinese carriers have been proponents of RCS for years , and last year, the Chinese government began the process of codifying into law that to achieve certification, new 5G devices will be required to support RCS . ( Here's a good English translation on Reddit of the parts relevant to Apple.) Shockingly, the Chinese government seemingly isn't concerned that the RCS standard has no provisions for encryption. The little birdies I've spoken to all said the same thing: iOS support for RCS is all about China.

Apple would prefer simply to continue ignoring RCS, on the grounds that they want to support neither any new non-E2EE protocols, nor any new carrier-controlled protocols (whether encrypted or not). But when the CCP says device makers must jump to sell their products in China, Apple asks “How high?”

China, unlike the EU, seemingly knows how to draft effective regulations to achieve specific goals.

entry.title: Putin Rival Alexei Navalny Dies in Siberian Prison
entry.content:
Robyn Dixon, David M. Herszenhorn, and Catherine Belton, reporting for The Washington Post:

Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny, the defiant anti-corruption crusader and democracy champion who was President Vladimir Putin's despised nemesis, died suddenly in an Arctic Russian prison colony on Friday, penitentiary officials said, removing the most prominent figure inside Russia willing to challenge the Kremlin's规则。

Referring to Navalny as Putin's “nemesis” — which description the Post also uses in its headline — whitewashes just how despicable his attempted assassination, yearslong imprisonment, and now (presumed) actual assassination were. It's a dysphemism — the opposite of a euphemism. Navalny was a political rival and staunch proponent of democracy. Putin was Navalny's nemesis, but not the other way around.

His death — foretold as almost inevitable, including by Navalny himself — sent shock waves across Russia and was quickly condemned by global leaders, some of whom joined Russian opposition figures in calling it a state-sponsored murder. Navalny, 47, had appeared a court hearing by video link the day before, seemingly in good health and with his trademark humor intact.

Navalny's family and his team, who continued to run his political operation in exile, had warned that his life was in danger since his arrest in January 2021, when he returned to Russia after recovering in Germany from being poisoned with a banned nerve agent. An investigation led by Navalny and Bellingcat, an investigative journalism organization, had identified a team of Russian federal security agents as responsible for the assassination attempt, and his supporters noted that in prison he was in the clutches of the very government that had already tried to kill him several times.

Until 2017, Navalny's death would have been met with bipartisan, near-universal condemnation here in the United States.不再。 But it shouldn't be surprising that a political party that has turned against fair democratic elections — a party whose undisputed leader has, just weeks ago, argued in court that the president of the United States could not be prosecuted in court for ordering the assassination of his political rivals — sees Vladimir Putin's Russia as a model to follow, not an enemy to defeat.

Nearly 250 years after the founding of our nation, genuine democracy remains a radical — and alas, fragile — idea.

★

entry.title: Meta's Oculus Quest App Lab
entry.content:
So I found an answer to my intrigue regarding Mark Zuckerberg's off-handed quip about “neural interfaces”, but I'm still at a loss to understand his positioning of Quest as the “open” alternative to Apple's “closed” Vision. One friend sent me a pointer to Meta's “App Lab”, which they announced in February 2021:

Whether the goal is to build a business, create a community, test and experiment with new apps, or get feedback on new ideas, you control how your app is distributed. App Lab supports both free and paid apps, which are shareable via a URL or Oculus Keys. While App Lab is distinct from the Oculus Store and App Lab apps won't appear in the Oculus Store, customers who install apps from App Lab will find them in their Quest library. App Lab apps can also be searched by exact name and found in the “App Lab” section of results. App Lab apps can access the majority of standard platform features, including automatic update distribution, platform integration and SDKs, app analytics, release channels, and more.

We've taken steps to reduce the technical requirements and Virtual Reality Checks (VRCs) to make submission as simple as possible. In order to promote a safe, secure and positive experience, App Lab apps are required to comply with our App Lab Policies , including our Oculus Content Guidelines , Data Use Policy , and App Policies .

Follow that link to “ App Policies ” and you'll see that this doesn't sound very different from Apple's iOS-derived platforms:

Apps hosted on the platform may not contain, use, or make available commerce solutions — including for app payment processing, in-app purchases, or in-app advertising — except as provided in the platform SDK, or otherwise expressly agreed by you and Meta Platforms Technologies in writing. For example, if your app has in-app purchases, and your app is distributed through any Meta Platforms Technologies distribution channel, including the Meta Quest Store, you must use the Platform In-App Purchases to handle such payment processing.

There's also a third-party thing called SideQuest that ostensibly lets you “sideload” apps on a Quest, but it requires both desktop software on a Mac or PC and a Meta developer account. I can definitely see how Quest is at least slightly more open than Vision, but on the grand scale of open-vs.-closed platforms, it seems pretty closed.我缺少什么？
